Reviews.Title: Great laptop but no bluetooth
Reviews.Author: Blue RR
Reviews.Content: Contrary to the Amazon product features description, this particular model does not have bluetooth installed, so keep that in mind if ever bluetooth constitutes an important feature for you. This laptop also has an integrated, non-user replaceable battery, which could be an issue 2 or 3 years from now when the battery dies (following the apple/ultrabook trend). The weight is also a bit heavy for the sleek form factor.Enough of the cons and on to the pros...Price - Compared with other laptops with comparable specs the price is very competitiveProcessor - Very capable processor with Passmark score of 2862 can handle anything you care to throw at it (aside from graphics intensive games, though I personally haven't tested it out).Looks - Brushed aluminum lid and metal accents on the faux speaker grill look classySound - Dolby home theater works wonders when you connect a set of headphonesBattery life - I got 6.5 hours on the first charge, though I'm still conditioning the battery. It's advertised to get 8+ hours.Power brick - Small, light and compactOS - from the feedback I've been reading on Windows 8, I'm glad I stuck with Windows 7 this time around. Maybe I'll consider Windows 9.In summary, it's a handsome, powerful, affordable laptop.

Reviews.Title: The best laptop I've owned
Reviews.Author: EM
Reviews.Content: If this computer had a built-in light, like Lenovo's think light, it would be perfect.  Otherwise, I like the design.  It really is a pretty computer.  Fast. Runs cool. Speaker sound is excellent. Long battery life.  Key placement good too.  Yeah, I really like this one.

Reviews.Title: THE BEST LAPTOP ON THE MARKET!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: NKul
Reviews.Content: This laptop is the epitome of an amazing laptop. It NEVER crashes, lags, or breaks down - and I've had it for a while now! It's amazing and I'd recommend it over any other laptop - the Sonys, the Toshibas, HPs, Asus, and even the Macs. It's reliable and best part is, for $450 you're getting quite a steal of a deal!!!

Reviews.Title: Great little Laptop
Reviews.Author: A customer "Jenn"
Reviews.Content: I've had great performance on this computer since I bought it last summer. For the price, I would definitely recommend this Laptop!

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Carolyn A Covelli
Reviews.Content: I love everything about it except that it doesn't have a number keypad. Super fast, runs very cool on your lap.

Reviews.Title: 1st Laptop
Reviews.Author: Wendy
Reviews.Content: This is my first laptop and my first computer upgrade in years.  I love the speed and it's size.  I have it hooked up to my LCD TV in the livingroom so the laptop is easier to hide than my old tower was.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: sonita
Reviews.Content: Very good computer! Not a fan of the blue color and a bit heavy, but otherwise met my expectations at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Suggest getting extended warranty - screen cracks easily
Reviews.Author: Mary J. Seitz "complex"
Reviews.Content: If not for the screen cracking on 2 of these, I would have rated it 5 star.I have had 2 of these and both of them the screen cracked from minor bumps.  The first was packed in a suitcase with 2 layers of clothes around it.  The suitcase was not dropped - just went into the hatchback of a Prius and out again and it was hand carried.  The second there was a pencil in the hinge and I gently started to close the laptop and the glass broke.And Acer support was rude and tried to get me to send it to them for support for $199.  My local repair shop will do it for $180, so it's going there.  I've only had the notebook for a month; the other one cracked after 2 months.So be very careful with it.  Don't let it outside in the hot sun or cold.Part of the issue is that it's a thin notebook.  I can twist the cover it's so thin.
